Reviews.Title: “If you are suicidal, this is your place!”
Reviews.Author: rtpfergy
Reviews.Content: The facility was fine, but it is managed by folks which seem to think they are inn keepers in Pirates of the Caribbean. All of the exterior doors were locked and not even able to be opened from the inside in case of a fire. The north stairway was obstructed with furniture and storage items like breakfast boxes, microwaves, and small efficiency refrigerators, like a closet. Hello!? Ever heard of emergency exits for fires? I spoke to the manager, and he told me in his broken English that they locked the doors to keep out prostitutes and other criminals. Nice! EVEN THE LOBBY DOOR WAS LOCKED FROM THE INSIDE DURING THE LATE HOURS, WHEN I VENTURED OUT TO MY VEHICLE! Once I raised holy Cain about this to get out, I saw why. There were prostitutes working the parking lot and they were of the most dreadful variety. I say this as a truck driver who has seem my share of true "Lot Lizards." The sleep was fine, the shower was pleasant. In the morning, I went to iron a shirt and it was ruined with the rust that poured out of the iron. The manager did not care when I explained the concerns. The Memphis Fire Department, however, sent an inspector IMMEDIATELY when I called. Look out for the hidden $1.50 charge for insurance and safe use, if you do not use it. This is a B.S. charge and I have to dispute it at check out at most hotels any more... If you'd like to die in a fire so your family can legitimately receive your life insurance and maybe some wrongful death suit income, stay here for a few days and hope for the best!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: rick v
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend. We needed direction to get us downtown for the new years celebrations and the front desk was able to give us great directions and even told us where to park. I was kinda nervous about being in a large city but the front desk made me feel completely comfortable and safe. Had a wonderful stay and they even offered late checkout for me because I overslept. Great Place!

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls”
Reviews.Author: specialed889
Reviews.Content: If you are unlucky enough to be in a room adjacent to another where anyone is talking or watching TV you will be sharing in their experience. The walls were so thin that for one person I could almost hear what they were saying. Overall the property seems fairly new but the door card locks are inexplicably corroded. The sink did not drain well, as the pull rod was not connected. Also at checkout, which was very early in the morning, the night clerk would not or could not comply with my request to remove the fee for the in room safe that I did not use. Dummy me, I guess when checking in (tired, after a long day) I should have read the fine print concerning initialing something I did not want. I don't think he understood English. In any event I called later and they called back to confirm they had taken it off. No I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay for less price”
Reviews.Author: 60769andy
Reviews.Content: room was clean and staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst Choice Hotel I've...”
Reviews.Author: Fotog
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Choice Hotel I've stayed. They allow smoking in the non smoking rooms, and it seems to be a magnet for the seedy side of town who like to stayup all night, slammimng doors, smoking & drinking in the Non-smoking hall (near the front desk).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but out of way”
Reviews.Author: nogbert
Reviews.Content: beware other reviews of this hotel they refer to the sleep inn in memphis there's no trolly near here . booked this thinking it was easy acess to beale st ect but had to drive everywhere which was easy enough, but I prefer to leave the car and have a good drink the hotel itself is good,and clean staff helpfull & friendly but a lot of places around the hotel are closed if I visit memphis again Iwould stay in the center

Reviews.Title: “Okay, for one night”
Reviews.Author: JudiMaguire
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay for the night. Walls are very thin, as I think our neighbors left their tv on all night. I slept pretty good though. Bed was comfortable. Was fairly easy to find. Nice and close to the BBQ restaurant we went to for dinner. Staff was very friendly and quite helpful in giving us directions to Beale St.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Inn room was OK. Left my $1200 Movado watch in the room”
Reviews.Author: jimmeshia
Reviews.Content: I came to Memphis for a Women's Conference with my church on June 27 and stayed two nights at Sleep Inn in Memphis on American Way. I must say the room was surprisingly nice; however, during my last night there I lost my $1200.00 Movado watch in the room. I advised the front desk of my lost. I had pulled the watch off in the room that evening to take a shower and discovered the next morning while I was getting dressed for church that I could not find my watch. I didn't make a big fuss about it because we were in a hurry and I thought maybe in my haste I may have placed it in my personal belongings. I did let the attendant at the front desk know to check the room thoroughly for my watch because I knew really in my heart of hearts it was in the room and may have fallen behind the night stand or just fell somewhere out of my eye sight. It wasn't possible for it to fall under the bed. Once I got back to Illinois and cleaned out my suitcase and personal affects, my watch was no where to be found. Just like I thought it was still in the room. I called back since no one bothered to call me and the guy at the front desk really didn't believe I had lost my watch in the room and he had a very nasty attitude and got very loud with me. The watch was very sentimental to me and I have had the watch for over 8 years. I cannot believe that it wasn't returned to me. Someone at this Sleep Inn hotel on American Way has my watch. I want to say to this person that found my watch, honesty is the best policy and nothing good will come to them. God sees all!

Reviews.Title: “Crime”
Reviews.Author: TexasRoller
Reviews.Content: Ok place, but, there was one MAJOR problem. There were ten vehicles broken into and items stolen on one of the nights I stayed at this Sleep Inn. My truck was one of the targets hit by these criminals, who were not caught. All of the vehicles sustained significant damage, plus many personal items were stolen. It would certainly appear that crime in the area of this hotel is a MAJOR problem. Be careful....

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tsandefur
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here last year during Memphis in May. We needed something cheap, so naturally that meant a bit far away. We got lost a little trying to make it downtown, but that's just because I need to brush up on my map reading skills. I wasn't expecting much before we got there, but we were both surprised at how great it was. It was clean and had everything we needed. The location was perfect for us, because it gave us an opportunity to see more parts of Memphis, especially during the fun, unintentional drives. The atmosphere was very relaxed and comfortable, but the staff was helpful with all our needs. We really enjoyed our stay, and would definitely stay there again, should the need arise.

HotelInfo.Name: Sleep Inn - Memphis / American Way
HotelInfo.Address: 5119 American Way, Memphis, TN 38115
